features: 5 Straws: WATERH Vita straw replacement, Stanley straw replacement, Simple Modern straw replacement, Hydro Flask Replacement Straws. (Can be cut to fit most stainless steel tumbler with Straw replacement)
Advanced Filtration Technology: The PureSip Filter is made of top-trade activated carbon, reduces chlorine and particulates. Meet NSF/ANSI 42, 53 & 401 standards.
Reduce your Carbon Footprint: This filter helps you reduce your carbon footprint by replacing up to 450 single-use plastic bottles (11 oz).
No Compromise on Flow: This filter instantly filters water as you sip through the bottle straw without compromising its flow.
Long-lasting Life: One WATERH PureSip Filter can last up to 2 months and can filter up 40 gallons of tap water.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars WATERH PureSip Adapt: Adaptable and Economical Hydration
reviews.reviewText: Finding a reliable water filtration solution has been a top priority for our household, as we live in an area with less-than-stellar tap water quality. Enter the WATERH PureSip Adapt Water Bottle Straw Replacement and Filters, and it's safe to say we've found our hydration helper. This set will be perfect for us as we save up for a large water filtration system, offering an economical solution to the pressing problem of poor water quality.This set of 5 straws and 3 filters is compatible with various stainless steel water tumblers, including WATERH Vita Bottle, Simple Modern, Stanley, Hydro Flask, and standard stainless steel water bottles with lids. The flexibility to cut the straws to fit different tumblers is a thoughtful touch, ensuring compatibility with different drinkware.This filter definitely reduces chlorine and particulates. The result? Water that not only tastes better but is cleaner and healthier for consumption. The filter ensures instant filtration as you sip through the bottle straw. One filter can last up to 2 months and filter up to 40 gallons of tap water. This means fewer replacements, less hassle, and more cost-effective hydration compared to constantly buying bottled water or frequently changing filters.One of the standout features is its contribution to reducing our carbon footprint. With each filter replacing up to 450 single-use plastic bottles, it's an eco-friendly choice that aligns with our commitment to sustainability. Not only are we enjoying clean water, but we're also making a positive impact on the environment. If you're tired of compromising on water quality, this product is a must-try!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect kit to keep you water filtered on the go
reviews.reviewText: I ordered these as replacements for the one in my WaterH smart bottle and quickly found that it can be applied to any bottle/tumbler that holds these larger diameter straws. Even if it isn't a smart bottle, you can cut one of the straws to fit your specific bottle. Then, if need be, trim the bottom and pop the filter on and install the top on your setup and bing bag boom filtered water to go. The filters have a more than adequate lifetime between changes. At this price it is an amazing value no matter how you plan to use it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not too hard to drink out of
reviews.reviewText: The WaterPh filter is easy to use and set up. The actual filter that goes into the water bottle is small and uncumbersome. The straws are made of a heavy duty plastic, which you can trim to fit the size of your water bottle. The straw is a bit smaller than a milkshake straw and its easier to drink out of than drinking a milkshake. There is a bit more effort to drink through the filter, but it was acceptable accounting for the the water going through the filter. If there was a lack of resistance I probably would have questioned the effectiveness of the filter, so I am pleased with this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I've always enjoyed drinking juice, but my doctor has consistently advised me to prioritize water for better health. Since acquiring the WATERH PureSip Adapt Water Bottle Straw Replacement and Filter, my relationship with water has transformed. It imparts a sweet and delicious taste, making my water-drinking habit increasingly addictive. Compatible with various popular bottles such as WATERH Vita, Simple Modern, Stanley, and Hydro Flask, these stainless steel tumblers with straws are not only versatile but also eco-friendly. The inclusion of three filters ensures a consistent supply of clean, filtered water. With five additional straws for convenience and flexibility, the WATERH PureSip Adapt stands out as the perfect addition to any water bottle, combining durability and filtration capabilities.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great healthy addition for your tumbler
reviews.reviewText: I got a WaterH tumbler as a gift and am really pleased with it but when I saw this option, I wanted to get it to help improve the water quality I was drinking. This installs easily and replacing the filters in the adapter is quick and simple too. After installing I have noticed a difference, my water tastes better and I can actually drink more than I could before without feeling like I had had enough for the day and wanted something different. I really like my WaterH bottle, but like it even more now. Great option.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Puts dissolved solids INTO the water
reviews.reviewText: Before using any filter on our tap water I always test it out first with water from our ZeroWater filter that is at 000 parts per million of total dissolved solids to see if the filter is putting anything into the water while it is theoretically taking stuff out. It was a bit more difficult than usual to test this out since it is a straw filter, but what I wound up doing was sipping the water halfway up the straw and putting my finger over the top and then flipping the straw and dropping the filtered water into a different cup. I did this a few times until there was enough water to test, and when there was it showed that the water had 32 ppm total dissolved solids in it.My photos show that the straw was in water with 000 ppm to start and the yellow cup is after being filtered through the straw.Nothing in the product photos or description says anything about adding anything to the water and the fact that there is something coming out of the filter into the water gives me enough pause to not want to drink from the straws.The straws are good quality plastic and were easy to assemble with the filters. The one that I assembled was easy to put in my water bottle and also fit in my 40oz tumbler nicely. They look and feel nice, but I just don't trust them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Makes water taste significantly better
reviews.reviewText: I recently moved to a place with VERY hard tap water and it smells strongly of chlorine. It's to the point where I typically do not drink it because it tastes off. This filter does make it taste drinkable. This straw filter is pretty easy to pull water from especially in comparison to other filter straws I've had. I do have a TDS reader and total dissolved solids were reduced dramatically it went from 188 to 56 which is pretty good for this little filter. I got tired of replacing expensive zero water filters really often, or buying bottled water. Hoping this helps!
